stanza.line: O me what eyes hath love put in my (a)head(/a)
Which have no correspondence with true (b)sight(/b)
Or if they have where is my judgment (a)fled(/a)
That censures falsely what they see (b)aright(/b)
If that be fair whereon my false eyes (c)dote(/c)
What means the world to say it is not (d)so(/d)
If it be not then love doth well (c)denote(/c)
Love's eye is not so true as all men's (d)no(/d)
How can it O how can love's eye be (e)true(/e)
That is so vexed with watching and with (f)tears(/f)
No marvel then though I mistake my (e)view(/e)
The sun it self sees not till heaven (f)clears(/f)
O cunning love with tears thou keep'st me (g)blind(/g)
Lest eyes well-seeing thy foul faults should (g)find(/g)
